intro: Eriogonum grande var. dunklei, commonly known as the Dunkle’s bigstem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of desert and foothill ecosystems.
